jd: From: Gaurav Nain, sibitalent.com g.nain@sibitalent.com Reply to: g.nain@sibitalent.com Job Title : IT Project Manager Visa : No H1B/OPT/CPT Location : Onsite in Quincy,MA Candidates need to be local and have worked locally as well (MA, RI or NH) – Must show ID proof of residency Engage with stakeholders to identify project expectations, goals and outcomes to determine project scope, objectives, and deliverables.Conduct meetings with EOHHS business areas to establish a mutual understanding of engagement objectives, timeline, roles, and deliverables.Collaborate with both business stakeholders and IT resources to develop comprehensive project plans with detailed milestones and activities outlining tasks, timelines, resources, and requirements.Coordinate with both internal and external stakeholders on the execution of activities according to project defined requirementsLiaise with the vendor as a key Point of Contact (POC) to facilitate business responses to vendor questions in a timely fashionAssist business and technical leads in the priorities that lead to the successful completion of requirementsMonitor results against established timelines, deliverables, tasks, dependencies and associated technical specificationsAssume Responsibility for overall coordination, facilitation, and aggregation of status reporting and health of the project, including keeping all levels of management appraised of project status.Lead the tracking and follow-up of risks, issues, and constraints and escalate where appropriateManage and maintain project documentation, ensuring that documentation is collected, version controlled, and available upon requestMaintain the confidentiality, integrity and availability of data across the organizationEnsure compliance with EOTSS, EOHHS, Security, and departmental policies, guidelines, and objectives. QUALIFICATIONS: Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Minimum of 5 (five) years of experience in technical project management.Strong operational and project management skills, including PMI and Agile project management experience in all software development lifecycle methodologies.Able to foster a collaborative work environment and demonstrate excellent leadership skills.Possess prior experience in Security and/or Compliance with some familiarity with NIST Risk Management, FIPS 199, 200, NIST 800-53 Security and Privacy Controls, NIST 800- 60 Mapping Types of Information and Information Systems to Security Categories.Possess strong organizational, presentation and customer service skills.Possess excellent problem-solving and team collaboration skills as required in project environment.
